articles.headline: Caliber Home Loans Embraces Borrowers With Spotty Credit
articles.snippet: Caliber, a unit of Lone Star, is one of the few firms with a big increase in the value of subprime mortgages it manages and services for homeowners.
articles.abstract: Caliber, a unit of Lone Star, is one of the few firms with a big increase in the value of subprime mortgages it manages and services for homeowners.
articles.lead_paragraph: Mortgages to borrowers with spotty credit histories have yet to come roaring back from the financial crisis, but they are on the rise at the private equity giant Lone Star Funds.

articles.headline: Downfall of ITT Technical Institutes Was a Long Time in the Making
articles.snippet: More than a decade ago, students found themselves locked out as federal agents searched for evidence of fraud.
articles.abstract: More than a decade ago, students found themselves locked out as federal agents searched for evidence of fraud.
articles.lead_paragraph: Doors were bolted shut and parking lots emptied at ITT Technical Institutes around the country this week after the chain of for-profit colleges announced it was closing for good.

articles.headline: China’s Big Debt Worries George Soros. Should It Worry You?
articles.snippet: Its borrowing binge looks familiar to those who study financial crises elsewhere. But others say China can cope if it makes the right choices.
articles.abstract: Its borrowing binge looks familiar to those who study financial crises elsewhere. But others say China can cope if it makes the right choices.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — The global economy is full of risks right now. Growth is sluggish, and central banks seem powerless to fix it. Europe faces persistent challenges and division. In America, the election looms.

articles.headline: What’s Really Missing From the New iPhone: Cutting-Edge Design
articles.snippet: The iPhone 7 doesn’t have a place to plug in headphones, but that is far from its worst shortcoming. The new device is an example of how Apple’s aesthetics have gone stale.
articles.abstract: The iPhone 7 doesn’t have a place to plug in headphones, but that is far from its worst shortcoming. The new device is an example of how Apple’s aesthetics have gone stale.
articles.lead_paragraph: Forget about the headphone jack for a second.

articles.headline: Obama on Climate Change: The Trends Are ‘Terrifying’
articles.snippet: More than health care, race or the economy, Mr. Obama believes his efforts to slow global warming will be the most consequential legacy of his presidency.
articles.abstract: More than health care, race or the economy, Mr. Obama believes his efforts to slow global warming will be the most consequential legacy of his presidency.
articles.lead_paragraph: MIDWAY ATOLL — Seventy-four years ago, a naval battle off this remote spit of land in the middle of the Pacific Ocean changed the course of World War II. Last week, President Obama flew here to swim with Hawaiian monk seals and draw attention to a quieter war — one he has waged against rising seas, freakish storms, deadly droughts and other symptoms of a planet choking on its own fumes.
articles.byline: By Julie Hirschfeld Davis, Mark Landler and Coral Davenport

articles.headline: Airbnb Adopts Rules to Fight Discrimination by Its Hosts
articles.snippet: The short-term rental company has been facing criticism that some hosts reject renters based on race, religion, gender, ethnicity, age or disability.
articles.abstract: The short-term rental company has been facing criticism that some hosts reject renters based on race, religion, gender, ethnicity, age or disability.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — For much of this year, Airbnb has been under fire over the ease with which its hosts can reject potential renters based on race, age, gender or other factors.

articles.headline: A Push to Lower Drug Prices That Hit Insurers and Employers the Hardest
articles.snippet: Seeking to force drug price competition in an expensive category, the company wants insurers to cover fewer anti-inflammatory drugs, at least as a first-line treatment.
articles.abstract: Seeking to force drug price competition in an expensive category, the company wants insurers to cover fewer anti-inflammatory drugs, at least as a first-line treatment.
articles.lead_paragraph: Americans have expressed outrage at drug companies for raising prices on products like EpiPen, the severe allergy treatment needed by thousands of children, and Daraprim, a rarely used but essential drug to treat a parasitic infection.
